alert.note: Alert for Caroline; Hanover; King William; King and Queen; New Kent (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 6:11PM EDT until June 17 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wakefield has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern King and Queen County in east central Virginia... Northwestern New Kent County in east central Virginia... Southeastern Caroline County in north central Virginia... Southeastern Hanover County in central Virginia... King William County in east central Virginia... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 611 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mangohick, or 11 miles east of Ashland, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * This severe thunderstorm will be near... Beulahville around 615 PM EDT. Studley around 630 PM EDT. Aylett around 635 PM EDT. Manquin around 640 PM EDT. King William and Tunstall around 655 PM EDT. Talleysville around 700 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include Enfield, Etna Mills, Epworth, Westwood, Rose Garden, Biscoe, Globe, Palls, Duane Fork and Wrights Corner. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 757-899-2415, posting to the NWS Wakefield Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSWAKEFIELDVA.

area.areaDesc: Caroline; Hanover; King William; King and Queen; New Kent
